lists.name: A Year of...

lists.description: Sir Walter Scott's 'Waverley', initially published anonymously and long considered the first historical novel in the west, celebrates its 200th anniversary this July.   Given that it is centered around the Scottish Jacobite uprising in 1745, it is perhaps fitting that this anniversary falls just two months before a referendum on Scottish independence from the UK.  Waverley was a hugely popular and influential novel, and Scott went on to write a series of historical works, anonymously, as the Author of Waverley--the Waverley Novels.   Here are a selection -enjoy!
lists.name: Sir Walter Scott's 'Waverley' novels

lists.description:
Walter Dean Myers, a celebrated author known for writing books about young African Americans, such as Monster, Fallen Angels and Hoops, has died. He was 76.

Myers' work includes six Newbery Honor Books and three National Book Award finalists. He won the first-ever Michael L. Printz Award for young adult literature and the first Coretta Scott King-Virginia Hamilton Award for Lifetime Achievement.

Here are a few of books, three of which made the ALA list of banned and challenged books.
lists.name: Walter Dean Myers

lists.description: There aren't many contemporary writers that could honestly be called a literary giant. Nobel laureate Gabriel Garcia Marquez was perhaps one of the last living examples.  Here is a partial list of his literary output that proves his greatness.
lists.name: Remembering Gabriel Garcia Marquez
